src:
Kalahkan Timor Leste 3-1, Fakhri Puji Pemain Timnas U-19 Ini
06 Nov 2019, 15:31 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta- Pelatih Timnas U-19, Fakhri Husaini, memuji penampilan bek Muhammad Salman Alfarid yang tampil apik mengawal lini pertahanan Tim Merah Putih dalam pertandingan melawan Timor Leste. Juru taktik berusia 54 tahun ini mengatakan Salman bisa menjadi pemain terbaik dalam pertandingan itu. "Salman juga bisa mematikan pemain nomor 9 yang meruopkan pemain potensial dari Timor Leste," kata Fakhri dalam konfrensi pers setelah pertandingan.
Mendapat pujian dari pelatihnya, Salman bersyukur bisa tampil baik mematikan Paulo Dominggos Freitas yang merupakan pemain yang berkualitas. "Pertandingan tadi intensitasnya tinggi juga, nomor 9 dia pemain bagus. Saya syukur bisa mengatasi, dia mengandalkan kecepatan, di udara juga bagus," kata dia.
Tim Nasional Indonesia U-19 atau Timnas U-19 mengalahkan Timor Leste U-19 dengan skor 3-1 dalam laga pertama babak Kualifikasi Piala AFC U-19 2020 Grup K di Stadion Madya, Gelora Bung Karno, Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Timnas U-19 mencetak gol cepat lewat Muhammad Fajar Fathur pada menit ke-2. Gol ini berawal dari tendangan sudut Beckham Putra yang diselesaikan dengan baik oleh Fajar lewat sundulan kepala. Gol ini membuat skuat Garuda Muda unggul 1-0 pada babak pertama.Timor Leste U-19 berhasil menyamakan kedudukan lewat gol Mouzinho De Lima yang sukses menjadi algojo tendangan penalti pada menit ke-51. Wasit memberikan hadiah tendangan penalti setelah kiper Ernando Ari Sutaryadi melakukan pelanggaran di kotak penalti ketika menghalau pergerakan pemain Timor Leste.
Pada menit ke-59, pemain Timor Leste, Nelson Pinto, diganjar kartu merah oleh wasit karena melakukan pelanggaran kepada Bagus Kahfi. Nelson melakukan tendangan dengan mengangkat kaki hingga mengenai muka Bagus.
Keunggulan jumlah pemain tak disia-siakan pemain Timnas U-19. Mereka terus melancarkan serangan ke pertahanan Timor Leste. Pada menit ke-62, kapten Timnas U-19, David Maulana, mencetak gol kedua bagi Indonesia. Umpan dari Fajar Fathur diselesaikan dengan tendangan keras dari luar kotak penalti.
Pada menit ke-77, Fajar menambah keunggulan bagi Timnas U-19. Ia sukses menyelesaikan umpan silang dari Supriadi, pemain yang masuk menggantikan Sutan Diego Armando Zico pada menit ke-53.

IRSYAN HASYIM
text:
Defeat Timor Leste 3-1, Fakhri Praises U-19 national team players
06 Nov 2019, 15:31 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta- U-19 national team coach, Fakhri Husaini, praised the performance of defender Muhammad Salman Alfarid who performed well guarding the Red and White Team defense in the match against Timor Leste. The 54-year-old tactician said Salman could be the best player in the match. "Salman can also turn off the number 9 player who has released potential players from East Timor," Fakhri said at a press conference after the match.
Received praise from his coach, Salman was grateful to be able to perform well to kill Paulo Dominggos Freitas who is a quality player. "The match was very high intensity, number 9 he was a good player. I am thankful he could handle it, he relied on speed, in the air it was also good," he said.
Indonesian U-19 National Team or U-19 national team defeated East Timor U-19 with a score of 3-1 in the first match of the AFC U-19 2020 Qualification Cup Group K at Madya Stadium, Gelora Bung Karno, Senayan, Jakarta, Wednesday, 6 November 2019.
U-19 national team scored a quick goal through Muhammad Fajar Fathur in the 2nd minute. This goal started from Beckham Son's corner kick that was completed well by Fajar through a header. This goal gave the Garuda Muda squad a 1-0 lead in the first half. East Timor U19 managed to equalize with a goal by Mouzinho De Lima who was a penalty shooter in the 51st minute. The referee awarded a penalty after goalkeeper Ernando Ari Sutaryadi committed a foul in the penalty box while fending off the movement of East Timor players.
In the 59th minute, Timor Leste's Nelson Pinto was rewarded by a referee for a foul on Bagus Kahfi. Nelson takes the kick by raising his foot to hit Bagus's face.
The superiority of the number of players is not wasted U-19 national team players. They continued to carry out attacks on the defense of East Timor. In the 62nd minute, the U-19 national team captain, David Maulana, scored the second goal for Indonesia. Bait from Fajar Fathur completed with a hard kick from outside the penalty box.
In the 77th minute, Fajar added an advantage for the U-19 national team. He successfully completed a cross from Supriadi, the player who came on for Sutan Diego Armando Zico in the 53rd minute.

IRSYAN HASYIM
